CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCDTBT
2. ladder-type polymers
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the updated "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PCDTBT
2. ladder-type polymers

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| ladder-type polymers |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! The "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCDTBT
2. ladder-type polymers
3. forced planarity
4. PCEs (short for "power conversion efficiency")
5. bandgap
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Property in the given paragraph:

1. PCDTBT
2. ladder-type polymers
3. bandgap

These three entities are relevant to the material properties of the polymers being discussed in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities from the paragraph, presented in the same words as in the original text:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| ladder-type polymers |
| bandgap |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 8 and our group 9 independently reported PCDTBT - based ladder - type polymers with forced planarity of which device performance showed impressive PCEs of up to 4.59% with reduced bandgap ( ca.

Let's think step by step.

The "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. 4.59% (the maximum PCE reported)
2. ca. (an abbreviation for "circa," meaning "approximately")
3. reduced bandgap (the value of the bandgap is not specified, but the fact that it is reduced is mentioned)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of a material property:

1. 4.59% (the maximum PCE reported)

The other entities, "ca." and "reduced bandgap," do not directly refer to the value of a material property, so they can be removed from the list.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the Markdown table with the valid entities:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.59% |

The table has one column, "Property Value," and one row with the value "4.59%," which is the maximum PCE reported in the paragraph.
